author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
Xbox did it again, and by "did it" we mean a Game Pass price hike. And by "again," we mean this is the second time in just over a year that they raised subscription prices. So far, only the Ultimate tier is getting a price increase, from $19.99 to $29.99 — an jump of 50%. In the U.K., the increase is about 53%. The lower tiers aren't changing in price, but are getting re-branded as Essential (replacing Core), and Premium (replacing Standard). There's also some extra perks coming to subscribers, but already the response from gamers has not been great. And in The Witcher news, creator Andrej Sapkowski regrets a single line that he wrote in the early days of the books, that now has become a big deal in the video games.
title: Xbox Drops Its Biggest Game Pass Price Hike, Starting Today - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
Left to raise two young sons after the unexpected death of his wife, Dad's life begins to unravel. Grief is messy and chaotic enough as it is, but when it takes the form of an unhinged and unwanted house guest - Crow - taunting him from the shadows, things start to spiral out of control...but maybe that's exactly what Dad needs.

#IGN #Gaming
title: The Thing with Feathers - Official Trailer (2025) Benedict Cumberbatch

author: IGN
description:
After a year of waiting, sucker punches followup to Ghost of Tsushima, Ghost of Yotei is finally here. But with multiple graphics settings and two PS5 consoles to choose from, which is the best version of the game for you? 

Gameplay Captured on a PS5 and and PS5 Pro
title: Ghost of Yotei - PS5 vs PS5 Pro Graphics Comparison | 4K 60 FPS

author: IGN
description: After a catastrophic military disaster, the dead don’t just rise - they hunt. The military insists they are harmless and slow-moving, offering hope to grieving families. But when Ava (Daisy Ridley) enters a quarantine zone searching for her missing husband, she uncovers the horrifying truth: the undead are growing more violent, more relentless, and more dangerous with every passing hour.
title: We Bury The Dead - Official Teaser Trailer (2025) Daisy Ridley

author: IGN
description: A remote village in Roman-era Egypt explodes into spiritual warfare when a carpenter, his wife, and their child are targeted by supernatural forces in The Carpenter’s Son. Joseph (Nicolas Cage), Mary (FKA twigs), and their teenage son Jesus (Noah Jupe) have lived for years under threat, clinging to their faith and traditions. But a stopover in a small settlement unleashes growing chaos when a mysterious stranger (Isla Johnston) tries to entice young Jesus to abandon his devout father’s rules. With every pull of temptation, the boy is lured into a forbidden world, as a terrified Joseph realizes that a demonic power is at work. Violent, unnatural events inexplicably follow Jesus, and he begins to experience nightmarish visions of the future. Finally, he learns the fearsome truth about his new playmate, as well as the child’s real name: Satan. Writer and director Lotfy Nathan, drawing from his Coptic Christian background, delivers a meticulously crafted, genre-bending supernatural thrill
title: The Carpenter's Son - Official Trailer (2025) Nicolas Cage, FKA twigs

author: IGN
description:

Previewed by Leana Hafer

author: IGN
description:
In this Hollow Knight Silksong boss fight, we go up against the Raging Conchfly in Act 2. This can be a frustrating fight due to the projectiles, but you do want to stay close when possible, just watching that you don't get hit as the Conchfly turns itself horizontal towards you before striking. The Pimpillo tool can also be very strong here since it's a large boss that does stay stationary long enough so you can use it.

Raging Conchfly (Sands of Karak)
Crest: Hunter
Throwable: Cogfly
Ability: Silkspear
Tools: Longclaw, Pollip Pouch, Pimpillo, Compass, Magnetite Brooch

For more info on Hollow Knight: Silksong, head to our wiki @ https://www.ign.com/wikis/hollow-knight-silksong
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Boss Fight - Raging Conchfly (Sands of Karak)

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Official Trailer for Psycho Killer, a horror cross-country road trip film distributed by 20th Century Studios. Psycho Killer is in theaters on February 20, 2026.

Following the brutal murder of her husband, a Kansas highway patrol officer sets out on a journey to track down the perpetrator. As the hunt progresses, she comes to realize the man responsible is a sadistic serial killer, and the depth of his mental depravity and his sinister agenda is more twisted than anyone could have imagined.

Psycho Killer stars Georgina Campbell, James Preston Rogers, Grace Dove, Logan Miller, Malcolm McDowell, and more. The film is written by Andrew Kevin Walker and produced by Roy Lee, Matt Berenson, Andrew Kevin Walker, and Arnon Milchan, with Martin Moszkowicz, Robert Kulzer, Yariv Milchan, Natalie Lehmann, and Kat Landsberg serving as executive producers.

Psycho Killer is in theaters on February 20, 2026.
title: Psycho Killer - Official Trailer (2026) Georgina Campbell, Malcolm McDowell

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Official Trailer for Frankenstein, a Guillermo del Toro horror movie based on the iconic character of Frankenstein, distributed by Netflix. Frankenstein premieres in theaters on October 17 with a release to Netflix on November 7.

A brilliant but egotistical scientist brings a creature to life in a monstrous experiment that ultimately leads to the undoing of both the creator and his tragic creation.

Frankenstein stars Oscar Isaac, Jacob Elordi, Mia Goth, Felix Kammerer, David Bradley, Lars Mikkelsen, Christian Convery, with Charles Dance, and Christoph Waltz. The film is directed by Guillermo del Toro, with the film being produced by Guillermo del Toro, J. Miles Dale, and Scott Stuber.

Frankenstein premieres in theaters on October 17 with a release to Netflix on November 7.

#Frankenstein #Movies #IGN
title: Frankenstein - Official Trailer (2025) Guillermo del Toro, Oscar Isaac, Jacob Elordi

author: IGN
description:
Get the best possible start in Ghost of Yotei with our breakdown of the 10 things you should do first! From unlocking merchants at the Old Inn to snagging powerful charms, rare armor, and essential weapons, these early steps will set you up for success in the dangerous Yotei Grasslands. Whether you’re looking to farm coin, expand your map quickly, or grab the Armor of the Undying before most players even know it exists, this guide has you covered.

In this video, we’ll cover everything from lifesaving charms and rare loot to quests and side activities that give Atsu a major advantage right at the start of his journey. Don’t miss these key tips if you want to survive, thrive, and dominate in Ghost of Yotei.

Get the rundown on all the changes coming to Xbox Game Pass, the hit games subscription service developed by Microsoft and Xbox. The tiers of Xbox Game Pass are all getting name changes with Xbox Game Pass Essential, Premium, and Ultimate. Xbox Game Pass Essential allows for PC and Cloud access as well alongside online multiplayer, in-game benefits, and over 50 console and PC games. Xbox Game Pass Premium is packed with over 200 console and PC games, with new Xbox-published games within a year of launch. Xbox Game Pass Ultimate will house over 400 console and PC games and more than 75 day-one games per year.

#XboxGamePass #Gaming #IGN

Explore the vast world of Ghost of Yotei with these essential beginner tips, hidden tricks, and things the game doesn’t tell you. From horse speed boosts and resource gathering to map fragments, bounties, and gear upgrades, we’ll help you get the most out of your journey across Ezo. In this video, we’ll break down the best ways to earn resources, uncover secrets, and build your arsenal early on. Whether it’s cooking at camp for powerful buffs, finding hidden charms, or managing your inventory, these tips will set you up for success as you take on Atsu’s story.

#IGN #Gaming
title: 15 Things Ghost of Yotei Doesn’t Tell You

author: IGN
description:
Digimon Story Time Stranger reviewed by George Yang on PlayStation 5, also available on PC and Xbox Series X|S.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger builds on its predecessors to deliver one of the best Digimon RPGs to date. It has a much m ore engaging story this time around thanks to its clever time travel setup and a charismatic and lively cast of Digimon characters. Even though its human cast pales in comparison, there’s still plenty to drive you through to the end of this time-hopping campaign. The turn-based combat is fairly straightforward, but the nuances in type matchups and the tinkering you can do with your party’s evolutions and movesets adds quite a lot of depth. So while this adventure has a few minor hiccups, it’s one that’ll make you very glad to be back in the Digital World.

#IGN #Gaming #Digimon
title: Digimon Story Time Stranger Review

author: IGN
description:
In Chapter 4 of Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, there’s a long questline that ends in you recruiting Final Fantasy 7’s Cloud, along with several other party members. Here’s a step-by-step guide detailing how to get him.

Timecodes:
0:00 - Intro
0:48 - In Chapter 4, Head to Clockwork City of Goug
1:00 - Read The Haunted Mine Rumor In Gollund, Then Go To Lesalia
01:10 - Choose Second Option With Beowulf
1:17 - Fight Through the Four Gollund Battles
03:05 - Head Back to Goug
03:14 - Finish Fort Besselat Battles
03:33 - Head to Sal Ghidos, and Buy the Flower
03:42 - Return to Goug
03:50 - Head to Zeltennia’s Tavern, and Read Nelveska Rumor
04:00 - Go to Nelveska Temple and Beat Construct 7
04:27 - Return to Goug
04:46 - Return to Sal Ghidos and Complete Battle
05:24 - Bonus - Get Cloud’s Secret Weapon
05:53 - Outro

For more on Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, check out our Wiki guide at https://www.ign.com/wikis/final-fantasy-tactics-the-ivalice-chronicles

#
title: Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles - How to Recruit Cloud (and Get His Secret Weapon)

author: IGN
description:
From Benny Safdie, half of the Safdie Brothers whose Good Time and Uncut Gems pulled exactly zero punches with their characters and subject matter, The Smashing Machine continues the filmmaker's trademark grounded and unflinching approach to obsessive people, just with a little less power behind its jabs.
 
Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt star in the A24 film that's been stirring up more than its share of Oscar buzz and film festival standing ovations. But is it missing too many teeth? Not from being punched in the face a whole bunch, I mean...

#IGN #Movies
title: The Smashing Machine Review

author: IGN
description:
With classics like Kiss Kiss Bang Bang and The Nice Guys under his belt, Shane Black is no stranger to infusing crime films with his whip-fast comedic sensibilities. Black and his cast (Mark Wahlberg, Rosa Salazar, Nat Wolff) explain to IGN how they kept up the pace in Play Dirty, the crime films that inspired their love of the genre, and how adapting a pulp crime series with over 20 entries worth of canon to consider compares to making a Marvel or DC movie, as Black did with Iron Man 3.

Play Dirty is available to stream now on Amazon Prime Video.
title: Play Dirty Director Shane Black's Secret to Good Improv? Cast Mark Wahlberg & Other "Magic People"

author: IGN
description:
Ghost of Yotei is finally here, and while it carries the spirit of Ghost of Tsushima, it makes some bold changes to the formula. From wolf companions and expanded combat to a more open-ended story and new weapons, Ghost of Yotei pushes the series forward in some exciting ways.

In this video, we’re breaking down the eight biggest changes from Ghost of Tsushima to Ghost of Yotei, including new gear loadouts, Atsu’s expanded arsenal, disarming attacks, and the dangers of notoriety as bounty hunters close in. Whether you’re a fan of Tsushima or jumping into the series for the first time, here’s everything you need to know about what sets Yotei apart.
title: Ghost of Yotei: 8 Biggest Changes From Tsushima

author: IGN
description:
In this Hollow Knight Silksong boss fight, we go up against the Unravelled. This is a boss that takes some doing to get to since you need the Surgeon's Key before going deeper into Whiteward. The fight itself is straight forward if you understand how the Unravelled attacks. Always shoot yourself to the wall it's leaving to get behind it. When it comes up from the ground in the middle of the arena, that's when you can stay near it and get a lot of attacks in.

Second Unravelled (Whiteward)
Crest: Hunter
Throwable: Cogfly
Ability: Silkspear
Tools: Druid's Eye, Weavelight, Cogwork Wheel, Compass, Magnetite Brooch

For more info on Hollow Knight: Silksong, head to our wiki @ https://www.ign.com/wikis/hollow-knight-silksong
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Boss Fight - Unravelled (Whiteward)

author: IGN
description:
In this Hollow Knight Silksong boss gameplay, we go up against the Second Sentinel. It's a long process to even awaken the Second Sentinel and trigger the Final Audience Wish, and then it's a challenging optional boss fight you can do in Act 2. You can sit inside of his guard and parry many of his attacks, but if he parries you, it's important to remember to jump straight up rather than trying to retreat. The Weighted Belt can also be very useful in this fight if you want to try and sit inside his guard and attack fast and hard.

1:00 - Boss fight begins

Loadout:
Second Sentinel (High Halls)
Crest: Hunter
Throwable: Cogfly
Ability: Silkspear
Tools: Druid's Eye, Weavelight, Cogwork Wheel, Compass, Magnetite Brooch

For more info on Hollow Knight: Silksong, head to our wiki @ https://www.ign.com/wikis/hollow-knight-silksong
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Boss Fight - Second Sentinel (High Halls)
